results.title: The Pawnshop [Silent]
results.creator_credit: Lone Star Corporation and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: Charlie Chaplin, handyman in a pawnshop, finds himself competing for the attention of the shop-owner’s daughter (Edna Purviance) with the pawnshop assistant. Shows Charlie as a combination janitor and assistant who gets involved in comic rivalry with the other assistant, causing confusion with customers and finally turning hero in a robbery. Cast also includes Henry Bergman, John Rand, Albert Austin, Wesley Ruggles and Eric Campbell.

results.title: The Pawnbroker
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, Roger Lewis, Phillip Langner and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: A powerful drama that focuses on Sol Nazerman (Rod Steiger), a middle-aged concentration camp survivor who lost his entire family to the Nazis and now runs a pawnshop in Harlem. His survival is a source of bewilderment and pain which has caused him to take refuge in misery and the condemnation of humanity. He is totally removed from the world of thieves and pimps that frequent his shop and displays no emotional vulnerability to the few people who try to penetrate his icy exterior. When his assistant Ortiz (Jaime Sanchez) sacrifices his own life for Sol during a robbery, the pawnbroker is finally confronted with the inherent goodness of the human spirit. Attacked at the time of its release for being anti-Semitic, anti-Black and pornographic, the film is also memorable for its innovative use of flashbacks to represent the disturbing flashes of Sol’s memory and the soundtrack composed by Quincy Jones. Also stars Geraldine Fitzgerald. Based on the novel by Edward Lewis Wallant.

results.title: The Pattern of Britain: crofters
results.creator_credit: Verity Films, Edgar H. Anstey and Ralph Keene
results.brief_description: The life of a crofting community in the extreme north-west of Scotland. By communal activity and shared effort, the people of this region make a living by agriculture, grazing and fishing. This film was made with the co-operation of the villagers of Achriesgill, in Southerlandshire, Scotland.

results.title: The Patriot [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Mutual Film Company, Centropolis Entertainment, Dean Devlin, Mark Gordon, Gary Levinsohn and Roland Emmerich
results.brief_description: A historical drama set during the American Revolution, based on the true story of war hero, General Francis Marion. Following the death of his wife, Colonel Benjamin Martin is content to abandon his post in the army to raise his seven children on his plantation in South Carolina. Turning his back on violence, Benjamin is stunned when his oldest son, Gabriel, leaves home and joins the fight against the British Army, despite his father’s refusal to join the Continental Army. Gabriel is injured and makes his way home to warn his family the war is getting closer. His warning is too late however, and when the English arrive, a fight breaks out on Benjamin’s plantation. When Colonel Tavington kills his son, Thomas, and captures Gabriel, Benjamin rethinks his decision not to fight. Vowing to avenge his son’s death, he rescues Gabriel and together they form a militia group, made up of Carolina patriots who will do anything to stop the British troops, and their leader Lord General Cornwallis. Cast includes Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson, Jason Isaacs and Tom Wilkinson.
